verses.verse: Hear<WH8085> you the word<WH1697> which<WH834> the LORD<WH3068> speaks<WH1696> to you, O house<WH1004> of Israel:<WH3478>

Thus<WH3541> said<WH559> the LORD,<WH3068> Learn<WH3925> not the way<WH1870> of the heathen,<WH1471> and be not dismayed<WH2865> at the signs<WH226> of heaven;<WH8064> for the heathen<WH1471> are dismayed<WH2865> at them.

For the customs<WH2708> of the people<WH5971> are vain:<WH1892> for one cuts<WH3772> a tree<WH6086> out of the forest,<WH3293> the work<WH4639> of the hands<WH3027> of the workman,<WH2796> with the ax.<WH4621>
They deck<WH3302> it with silver<WH3701> and with gold;<WH2091> they fasten<WH2388> it with nails<WH4548> and with hammers,<WH4717> that it move<WH6328> not.

They are upright<WH4749> as the palm<WH8560> tree, but speak<WH1696> not: they must needs be borne,<WH5375> because<WH3588> they cannot<WH3808> go.<WH6805> Be not afraid<WH3372> of them; for they cannot<WH3808> do evil,<WH7489> neither<WH1571> <WH369> also<WH1571> is it in them to do good.<WH3190>
For as much as there is none<WH369> like<WH3644> to you, O LORD;<WH3068> you are great,<WH1419> and your name<WH8034> is great<WH1419> in might.<WH1369>

Who<WH4310> would not fear<WH3372> you, O King<WH4428> of nations?<WH1471> for to you does it appertain:<WH2969> for as much as among all<WH3605> the wise<WH2450> men of the nations,<WH1471> and in all<WH3605> their kingdoms,<WH4467> there is none<WH369> like<WH3644> to you.
But they are altogether<WH259> brutish<WH1197> and foolish:<WH3688> the stock<WH6086> is a doctrine<WH4148> of vanities.<WH1892>

Silver<WH3701> spread<WH7554> into plates is brought<WH935> from Tarshish,<WH8659> and gold<WH2091> from Uphaz,<WH210> the work<WH4639> of the workman,<WH2796> and of the hands<WH3027> of the founder:<WH6884> blue<WH8504> and purple<WH713> is their clothing:<WH3830> they are all<WH3605> the work<WH4639> of cunning<WH2450> men.

But the LORD<WH3068> is the true<WH571> God,<WH430> he is the living<WH2416> God,<WH430> and an everlasting<WH5769> king:<WH4428> at his wrath<WH7110> the earth<WH776> shall tremble,<WH7493> and the nations<WH1471> shall not be able<WH3201> to abide<WH3557> his indignation.<WH2195>

Thus<WH1836> shall you say<WH560> to them, The gods<WH426> that have not made<WH5648> the heavens<WH8065> and the earth,<WH778> even they shall perish<WH7> from the earth,<WH772> and from under<WH8460> these<WH429> heavens.<WH8065>

He has made<WH6213> the earth<WH776> by his power,<WH3581> he has established<WH3559> the world<WH8398> by his wisdom,<WH2451> and has stretched<WH5186> out the heavens<WH8064> by his discretion.<WH8394>

When he utters<WH5414> his voice,<WH6963> there is a multitude<WH1995> of waters<WH4325> in the heavens,<WH8064> and he causes the vapors<WH5387> to ascend<WH5927> from the ends<WH7097> of the earth;<WH776> he makes<WH6213> lightning<WH1300> with rain,<WH4306> and brings<WH3318> forth<WH3318> the wind<WH7307> out of his treasures.<WH214>

Every<WH3605> man<WH120> is brutish<WH1197> in his knowledge:<WH1847> every<WH3605> founder<WH6884> is confounded<WH3001> by the graven<WH6459> image:<WH6459> for his molten<WH5262> image is falsehood,<WH8267> and there is no<WH3808> breath<WH7307> in them.
They are vanity,<WH1892> and the work<WH4639> of errors:<WH8595> in the time<WH6256> of their visitation<WH6486> they shall perish.<WH6>

The portion<WH2506> of Jacob<WH3290> is not like them: for he is the former<WH3335> of all<WH3605> things; and Israel<WH3478> is the rod<WH7626> of his inheritance:<WH5159> The LORD<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> is his name.<WH8034>
Gather<WH622> up your wares<WH3666> out of the land,<WH776> O inhabitant<WH3427> of the fortress.<WH4693>

For thus<WH3541> said<WH559> the LORD,<WH3068> Behold,<WH2005> I will sling<WH7049> out the inhabitants<WH3427> of the land<WH776> at this<WH2063> once,<WH6471> and will distress<WH6887> them, that they may find<WH4672> it so.
Woe<WH188> is me for my hurt!<WH7667> my wound<WH4347> is grievous;<WH2470> but I said,<WH559> Truly<WH389> this<WH2088> is a grief,<WH2483> and I must bear<WH5375> it.

My tabernacle<WH168> is spoiled,<WH7703> and all<WH3605> my cords<WH4340> are broken:<WH5423> my children<WH1121> are gone<WH3318> forth<WH3318> of me, and they are not: there is none<WH369> to stretch<WH5186> forth my tent<WH168> any more,<WH5750> and to set<WH6965> up my curtains.<WH3407>

For the pastors<WH7462> are become<WH1197> brutish,<WH1197> and have not sought<WH1875> the LORD:<WH3068> therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> they shall not prosper,<WH7919> and all<WH3605> their flocks<WH4830> shall be scattered.<WH6327>

Behold,<WH2009> the noise<WH6963> of the bruit<WH8052> is come,<WH935> and a great<WH1419> commotion<WH7494> out of the north<WH6828> country,<WH776> to make<WH7760> the cities<WH5892> of Judah<WH3063> desolate,<WH8077> and a den<WH4583> of dragons.<WH8577>
O LORD,<WH3068> I know<WH3045> that the way<WH1870> of man<WH120> is not in himself: it is not in man that walks<WH1980> to direct<WH3559> his steps.<WH6806>
O LORD,<WH3068> correct<WH3256> me, but with judgment;<WH4941> not in your anger,<WH639> lest<WH6435> you bring me to nothing.<WH4591>

Pour<WH8210> out your fury<WH2534> on the heathen<WH1471> that know<WH3045> you not, and on the families<WH4940> that call<WH7121> not on your name:<WH8034> for they have eaten<WH398> up Jacob,<WH3290> and devoured<WH398> him, and consumed<WH3615> him, and have made<WH6213> his habitation<WH5116> desolate.<WH8074>
